intro: Cicuta pumila, commonly known as the lesser water hemlock, is a toxic plant native to North America. It is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white flowers. The plant contains toxic compounds such as cicutoxin, which can be lethal if ingested. It typically grows in wet or marshy areas, often near water sources. Due to its high toxicity, it is considered a noxious weed and requires careful handling.
